result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beau E. Zinsmeister

defendant.name: Zinsmeister, Beau E.
defendant.address: W9811 Co Rd C, Deerbrook, WI

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 2:41 PM/ RM 301, 22CF163 & 22CM83. Defendant Beau E. Zinsmeister in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's. Def. has contacted PD Office and does qualify. Def. does wish to have counsel. Court advises Def. of right to have P.H. within time limits and questions if Def. would like to go past time limits. Def. wishes to waive time limits. Court accepts waiver of time limits and finds good cause. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No contact with victim. 
Def. not to possess dangerous weapons.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

Court calls @ 2:26 PM 22CF163 & 22CM83. Defendant Beau E. Zinsmeister in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaints, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victim rights. State questions if Def. is currently on probation. Def. confirms. State notes Def. prior record and gives bail bond recommendations and requests on 22CF163, $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no contact with victim and Def. not possess firearms. 22CM83, $500.00 cash bond with same conditions in 22CF163. Def. is in agreeance. Court questions Def. employment and reviews criminal complaints. Court considers bail bond factors and orders on 22CM83 $500.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with victim and Def. not to possess dangerous weapons. 22CF163, Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with victim and Def. not to possess dangerous weapons. Def. to pay $300.00 today and $200.00 by end of business day on 9/27/22, by 4:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
